==naval armed guardsmen== This article about World War I contains a link regarding 'naval armed guardsmen' that resolves to [[:United States Navy Armed Guard]]. The latter article only points to World War II activities. Author may want to check this out. [[User:Hmains|Hmains]] ([[User talk:Hmains|talk]]) 02:48, 13 September 2016 (UTC) :Yes, one of these is clearly wrong. I noticed this before I read the talk page here. Also, compared to other FAs on ships, this is ridiculously short. How it meets the comprehensive standards of FAs is beyond me. <!-- Template:Unsigned IP --><small class="autosigned">â€” Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/2600:8805:5800:AD00:9C9D:6AB3:CBF8:A317|2600:8805:5800:AD00:9C9D:6AB3:CBF8:A317]] ([[User talk:2600:8805:5800:AD00:9C9D:6AB3:CBF8:A317|talk]]) 12:22, 13 September 2016 (UTC)</small> <!--Autosigned by SineBot-->
== References ==
Current ref 22 is "Sharpe, p. 359", but I cannot see this in the bibliograpy. Also one of the [http://web.archive.org/web/20070712062945/http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/m14/montanan.htm DANFS links] fails due to robot.txt (or at least it does for me).
